EMPTY_LIST

public static final java.util.List<java.lang.String> EMPTY_LIST
Static empty list.

KEY_DELIMITER

public static final java.lang.String KEY_DELIMITER
Delimiter used in storing the message key. The message key is concatenated with the product short name, using this delimeter.

getTokens

public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTokens(java.lang.String pMessage)
Extracts the tokens from the string. Tokens are:
  • All uppercase alpha-numerics and underscores
  • Begins with a single ampersand
The ampersand will is not be part of the token name.

Parameters:
pMessage - Message of the token.
Returns:
Return the list of tokens

getTokens

public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTokens(java.util.regex.Pattern pPattern,
                                                         java.lang.String pMessage)
Extracts the tokens from the string. Tokens are:
  • All uppercase alpha-numerics and underscores
  • Begins with a single ampersand
The ampersand will is not be part of the token name.

Parameters:
pPattern - Pattern to use for extracting Tokens
pMessage - String containing the tokens to extract
Returns:
Return the list of tokens

listToMap

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> listToMap(java.util.List<TokenValueVORow> pTokens)
Convert a list of TokenValueVO rows with token names and values to a Map. Token name is the Map key, map value will be an object of appropriate type for the token type: TEXT = java.lang.String NUMBER = java.math.BigDecimal DATE = java.sql.Timestamp

Parameters:
pTokens -
Returns:
Map of token name/value objects

mapToList

public static java.util.List<TokenValueVORow> mapToList(TokenValueVOImpl pToken,
                                                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> pTokens)
Convert a Map of token name/value object to a list of TokenValueVO rows. Objects in the map are expected to match the declared type of the token: TEXT = java.lang.String NUMBER = java.math.BigDecimal DATE = java.sql.Timestamp Note callers are responsible for freeing the list of VORows returned by this method.

Parameters:
pToken - The TokenValueVOImpl class
pTokens - Map of token names/value objects
Returns:
List of TokenValueVO rows, one row for each token/value pair.

format

@Deprecated
public static java.lang.String format(MessageVORow pMessage,
                                                 java.lang.String pText,
                                                 java.util.List<TokenValueVORow> pTokens)
Deprecated. Use format(MessageVORow, String, Map) instead.

Get a token substituted message component.

Parameters:
pMessage - The Message to be formatted
pText - Text to be formatted. Typically this will be one of components of pMessage.
pTokens - List of rows with token name/values to substitute
Returns:
Returns the formatted string.

format

public static java.lang.String format(MessageVORow pMessage,
                                      java.lang.String pText,
                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> pTokens,
                                      boolean escapeSpecial)
Get a token substituted message component.

Parameters:
pMessage - The Message to be formatted
pText - Text to be formatted. Typically this will be one of components of pMessage.
pTokens - A map of token name-value pairs
escapeSpecial - escape special chars for MessageFormat processing. Pass false only if special chars have already been replaced.
Returns:
Returns the formatted string.

buildEncoded

public static java.lang.String buildEncoded(java.lang.String pAppShortName,
                                            java.lang.String pMessageName,
                                            java.util.List<java.lang.String> pTokens)
Returns the Message Text in encoded format. Note that this String will require token replacement. Encoded format is [APP_SHORT_NAME]␀[TEST_MESSAGE_NAME]␀ (N␀[TOKEN_NAME]␀{[TOKEN_NAME]}␀)*

Returns:
Encoded Message Text

createEncoded

public static java.lang.String createEncoded(MessageEOImpl pMsg)
Returns the Message Text in encoded format. Note that this String will require token replacement. Encoded format is [APP_SHORT_NAME]␀[TEST_MESSAGE_NAME]␀ (N␀[TOKEN_NAME]␀{[TOKEN_NAME]}␀)*

Returns:
Encoded Message Text

pText -

breakApartKey

public static java.lang.String[] breakApartKey(java.lang.String pMsgKey)
Break apart a message key, in the format appShortName:::messageName into an array of appShortName and messageName components

Parameters:
pMsgKey, - in the format "appShortName:::messageName"
Returns:
array of appShortName, messageName

untokenize

public static java.lang.Object[] untokenize(java.lang.String pMsgKey,
                                            java.lang.Object... params)
Construct array of values for each token in the message, in order tokens are declared. Params is expected to be a list with an even number of elements, alternating token names and an object representing the value of that token. Token names are expected to be String, and values are expected to be an object of appropriate type for the token data type. TEXT = java.lang.String NUMBER = java.math.BigDecimal DATE = java.sql.Timestamp

Parameters:
pMsgKey - Message key, in the format "appShortName:::messageName"
params - List of token name/value pairs
Returns:
Array of token values

untokenize

public static java.lang.Object[] untokenize(java.lang.String pMsgKey,
                                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> params)
Construct array of values for each token in the message, in order tokens are declared. Params is expected to be a Map with token name as the key, and an object of appropriate type for the token data type as the value. TEXT = java.lang.String NUMBER = java.math.BigDecimal DATE = java.sql.Timestamp

Parameters:
pMsgKey - Message key, in the format "appShortName:::messageName"
params - Map of token name/value pairs
Returns:
Array of token values

untokenize

public static java.lang.Object[] untokenize(java.lang.String pApp,
                                            java.lang.String pName,
                                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> params)
Construct array of values for each token in the message, in order tokens are declared. Params is expected to be a Map with token name as the key, and an object of appropriate type for the token data type as the value. TEXT = java.lang.String NUMBER = java.math.BigDecimal DATE = java.sql.Timestamp

Parameters:
pApp - Message application short name
pName - Message Name
params - Array of token name/value pairs
Returns:
Array of token values

untokenize

public static java.lang.Object[] untokenize(MessageVORow pMsg,
                                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> params)
Convert token value Map to an array of token values, in order tokens are declared. Params is expected to be a Map with token name as the key, and an object of appropriate type for the token data type as the value. TEXT = java.lang.String NUMBER = java.math.BigDecimal DATE = java.sql.Timestamp

Parameters:
pMsg - The message row
params - Array of token name/value pairs
Returns:
Array of token values

untokenize

public static java.lang.Object[] untokenize(java.lang.String pApp,
                                            java.lang.String pName,
                                            java.lang.Object... params)
Convert token value Map to an array of token values, in order tokens are declared. Params is expected to be a list with an even number of elements, alternating token names and an object representing the value of that token. Token names are expected to be String, and values are expected to be an object of appropriate type for the token data type. TEXT = java.lang.String NUMBER = java.math.BigDecimal DATE = java.sql.Timestamp

Parameters:
pApp - Message application short name
pName - Message name
params - List of token name/value pairs
Returns:
Array of token values

createResourceBundleMessage

public static java.lang.String createResourceBundleMessage(java.lang.String pMsg,
                                                           oracle.jbo.RowIterator pTokens)
Convert a message component with named tokens to one with numbered tokens, suitable for use with native java MessageFormat class. For example: converts "Message with text: {TEXT_TOKEN} number: {NUM_TOKEN} date: {DATE_TOKEN}" to "Message with text: {1} number: {2, number} date: {3, date}"

Parameters:
pMsg - Message with named tokens
pTokens - Iterator over list of tokens
Returns:
pMsg converted to MessageFormat style

createResourceBundleMessage

public static java.lang.String createResourceBundleMessage(MessageVORow pMsg)
Convert messageText (the short message) component to MessageFormat-style message.

Parameters:
pMsg - The message to convert
Returns:
MessageFormat-style formatted messaageText

Convert messageText (the short message) component to MessageFormat-style message.

Parameters:
pMsg - The message to convert
Returns:
MessageFormat-style formatted messaageText

buildDetails

public static java.lang.String buildDetails(java.lang.Object key)
Return the message text components, in XML format. Tokens are not yet substituted, and will be returned as named tokens.

Parameters:
key - Message key, in the format APP:::MESSAGE_NAME
Returns:
The messgae XML.

buildDetails

public static java.lang.String buildDetails(java.lang.Object key,
                                            boolean for_resource_bundle)
Return the message text components, in XML format. Tokens are not yet substituted

Parameters:
key - Message key, in the format APP:::MESSAGE_NAME
for_resource_bundle - If true return message with numbered (positional) tokens. If false then return named tokens.
Returns:
The message XML.

getResourceBundleMessageText

public static java.lang.String getResourceBundleMessageText(java.lang.Object key)
Gets the resource bundle text of a message.

Parameters:
key - the message key
Returns:
the resource bundle text; null if the key is null or the message service is not available

buildDetails

public static java.lang.String buildDetails(MessageServiceAMImpl pService,
                                            java.lang.String pAppShortName,
                                            java.lang.String pMessageName,
                                            boolean for_resource_bundle)
Return the message text components, in XML format. Tokens are not yet substituted, and may be returned as numbered or named, based on for_resource_bundle parameter.

Parameters:
pService - A MessageService instance
pAppShortName - Message application short name
pMessageName - Message name
for_resource_bundle - If true return message with numbered (positional) tokens. If false then return named tokens.
Returns:
The message XML

public static java.lang.String buildDetails(MessageVORow pMessage)
Return the message text components, in XML format. Tokens are not yet substituted, and will be left as named tokens.

Parameters:
pMessage - The message row.
Returns:
The message XML.

                                            boolean for_resource_bundle)
Return the message text components, in XML format. Tokens are not yet substituted.

Parameters:
pMessage - The message row.
for_resource_bundle - If true return message with numbered (positional) tokens. If false then return named tokens.
Returns:
The message XML.

buildDetails

public static java.lang.String buildDetails(MessageVORow pMessage,
                                            java.lang.String pDetails,
                                            java.lang.String pAction)
Return the message text components, in XML format. Tokens are not yet substituted, and will be returned as named tokens

Parameters:
pMessage - The message row.
pDetails - Message Detail string (will be user or admin)
pAction - Message Action String (will be user or admin)
Returns:
The message XML.

public static java.lang.String buildDetails(MessageVORow pMessage,
                                            java.lang.String pDetails,
                                            java.lang.String pAction,
                                            boolean for_resource_bundle)

Parameters:

pDetails - Message Detail string (will be user or admin)
pAction - Message Action String (will be user or admin)
for_resource_bundle - If true return message with numbered (positional) tokens. If false then return named tokens.

formatHTMLMessage

public static java.lang.String formatHTMLMessage(java.lang.Exception e)
Return the formatted, token-substituted short message text, suitable for use in HTML. Not the string returned does not actually contain HTML, but is meant to be used when displaying an HTML message.

Parameters:
e - The exception
Returns:
Formatted, token substituted short message text.

public static oracle.adf.model.binding.DCErrorMessage formatHTMLDetailMessage(java.lang.Exception e)
Return a detail message object, contructed from an exception.

Parameters:
e - The exception
Returns:
The detail message object.

formatHTMLMessage

public static java.lang.String formatHTMLMessage(java.lang.String xml)
Return the formatted, token-substituted short message text, suitable for use in HTML. Not the string returned does not actually contain HTML, but is meant to be used when displaying an HTML message.

Parameters:
xml - The XML string to be processed
Returns:
Formatted, token substituted short message

formatHTMLMessageWithIncident

public static java.lang.String formatHTMLMessageWithIncident(java.lang.String xml,
                                                             java.lang.String inc)
Return the formatted, token-substituted short message text, suitable for use in HTML. Not the string returned does not actually contain HTML, but is meant to be used when displaying an HTML message.

Parameters:
xml - The XML string to be processed
inc - A separate string with incident info to be included with the message
Returns:
Formatted, token substituted short message

Parameters:
xml - An FndResourceBundle message, in xml format
Returns:
The detail message object.

formatHTMLDetailMessageWithIncident

                                                                                          java.lang.String inc)
Return a detail message object, contructed from an exception.

Parameters:
xml - An FndResourceBundle message, in xml format
inc - separate string with incident info to be included with the message
Returns:
The detail message object.

formatTextMessage

public static java.lang.String formatTextMessage(java.lang.String xml)
Get a formatted text version of the message. Unlike HTML, there are no separate APIs for the short and detailed text messages. This returns the entire text message, short and detailed parts appended.

Parameters:
xml - The message in XML format
Returns:
The text formatted message string.

replaceAll

public static java.lang.String replaceAll(java.util.regex.Matcher m,
                                          java.lang.String replacement,
                                          java.lang.String searched,
                                          java.util.Locale loc)
Find and replace all the occurences of a text in a string

Parameters:
m - - matcher to find the ocurrence of a text
replacement - - text to replace
searched - - text to be searched. original message
loc - - Search & replace Locale
Returns:
